fields.description:
[~sjones], [~viglesias], [~mclark], [~tsugawa], [~zhill]

Hi all,

In order to support multiple network gateways with Euca 4.2+VPC+Mido, we need to allow the administrator to tell Eucalyptus about what midonet (midolman) servers are set up to be the midonet virtual->phy gateways.  Currently, in the network JSON, we have space for just a single entry 

"Mido": {
...
    "GatewayHost": "g-15-07.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com",
    "GatewayIP": "10.116.133.121",
    "GatewayInterface": "em1.116",
...
  },

in order to support multiple gateways, we'll need a way for the user to specify more than one of these tuples - currently, mido recommends a max of six (if we want to put in a constraint of 6 max that would be way to limit possible problems).  I've implemented already the 'local' override, where eucanetd will read a list from eucalyptus.conf if present, but for consistency I think we should support this in the network JSON.

Open for discussion!  Each gateway needs the same 3 values specified, but we need to be able to specify more than one.

Best
-Dan

comments.body:
Sounds good to me, I think this will require some coordination as we switch the format of the network broadcast (the JSON config property would support old/new formats)

Should I change this into a story?

Sounds good, was just looking at this for our CB. 
In addition to making Gateways a list of tuples/dicts, maybe make  'EucanetdHost' --> 'EucanetdHosts' a list of hostnames as well?

[~mclark] - we can do that for maybe planning for the future, but there is only one eucanetd host for now (must be CLC co-located)

Steve - yes, by all means convert to story if that is the right format, procedurally

-D

[~nurmi], is this what you were thinking for the network information?:

{code}
<network-data>
  <configuration>
    <property name="mode">
      <value>VPCMIDO</value>
    </property>
    ...
    <property name="mido">
      <property name="eucanetdHost">
        <value>a-35.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com</value>
      </property>
      <property name="gatewayHost">
        <value>a-35.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com</value>
        <value>a-36.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com</value>
      </property>
      <property name="gatewayIP">
        <value>10.116.133.77</value>
        <value>10.116.133.78</value>
      </property>
      <property name="gatewayInterface">
        <value>em1.116</value>
        <value>em1.117</value>
      </property>
      <property name="publicNetworkCidr">
        <value>10.116.0.0/17</value>
      </property>
      <property name="publicGatewayIP">
        <value>10.116.133.67</value>
      </property>
    </property>
    ...
  </configuration>
  ...
</network-data>
{code}

so three properties that are lists of the same length, as opposed to something like:

{code}
<property name="mido">
  <property name="gateways">
    <gateway name="gateway1">
      <property name="gatewayHost">
        <value>a-35.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com</value>
      </property>
      <property name="gatewayIP">
        <value>10.116.133.77</value>
      </property>
      <property name="gatewayInterface">
        <value>em1.116</value>
      </property>
    </gateway>
    <gateway name="gateway1">
      <property name="gatewayHost">
        <value>a-36.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com</value>
      </property>
      <property name="gatewayIP">
        <value>10.116.133.78</value>
      </property>
      <property name="gatewayInterface">
        <value>em1.117</value>
      </property>
    </gateway>
  </property>
</property>  
{code}

either approach works for me, the second is more consistent with the existing format.

[~sjones]

I like the second approach, since the data is related.  In terms of checking (not sure how much input validation is done, but just in case):

- all three items are needed for a given gateway
- at least one gateway needs to be present
- midonet max is six gateways (this is not as crucial and is mido specific, but may be a 'safe' check)

The branch dev-sjones-euca-11149 is updated to broadcast the below network information:

{code}
<network-data>
  <configuration>
    <property name="mode">
      <value>VPCMIDO</value>
    </property>
    ...
    <property name="mido">
      <property name="gateways">
        <gateway>
          <property name="gatewayHost">
            <value>a-35.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com</value>
          </property>
          <property name="gatewayIP">
            <value>10.116.133.77</value>
          </property>
          <property name="gatewayInterface">
            <value>em1.116</value>
          </property>
        </gateway>
        <gateway>
          <property name="gatewayHost">
            <value>a-36.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com</value>
          </property>
          <property name="gatewayIP">
            <value>10.116.133.78</value>
          </property>
          <property name="gatewayInterface">
            <value>em1.117</value>
          </property>
        </gateway>
      </property>
      <property name="eucanetdHost">
        <value>a-35.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com</value>
      </property>
      ...
    </property>
    ...
  </configuration>
  ...
</network-data>
{code}

The configuration has a new "Gateways" property that is a list of items each with the three properties, minimum size one, maximum size six, e.g.:

{code}
    {
        "Mode": "VPCMIDO",
        "PublicIps": [
            "..."
        ],
        "Mido": {
          "EucanetdHost": "...",
          "Gateways": [
            {
              "GatewayHost": "...",
              "GatewayIP": "...",
              "GatewayInterface": "..."
            }
          ],
          "PublicNetworkCidr": "...",
          "PublicGatewayIP": "..."
        }
    }
{code}

I added a EUCA-11173 task to this story for the related backend work.

commit 828bc03841f10e702af9a2e8e4326535a6649a41
Author: Daniel Nurmi <nurmi@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 23 09:58:37 2015 -0700

    update to allow for multiple GW hosts addrs and interfaces in the network config json.  EUCA-11173 and EUCA-11149
Tests passed CI as well as initial rounds of load testing.
